data.title: Chevron Techron Fuel Injector Cleaner
data.meta_description: Anyone know where Chevron Techron fuel injection cleaner is available in Australia, BMW has it branded as there own but when i ring the local BMW shop...
data.text:
I had a clogged injector on a car, tried the Techron for about 30 km and didn't clear it, then tried Nulon, which did within a couple of Ks

Not really a fair comparison, as the Techron may have been working slowly and it might have eventually cleared without the Nulon, but I still add a little Nulon to all my vehicles every couple of months or so and I haven't had any problems since.

Found some, it's the Caltex Techron 5000 and after a short ride the bike will now start from cold first stab of the button, that's another problem solved. From what i have been reading all your premium fuels like BP ultimate and the Caltex with techron are fine once the injectors are clean but this bike has been sitting for a while and the fuel had gone off and the injectors were gummed up i think. all good now.

My cars handbook recommends using a cleaner every two or three months, and when I do I share it between the cor and the bikes.

Premium juice costs around 20 cents a litre more than regular so one tankfull in the car costs just about as much as a premium cleaner, and more than the K Mart product.

I think most are just naptha which is probably worth 20 cents a litre anyway!
